objects.name: Permission Groups Discovery
objects.description: Adversaries may attempt to find local system or domain-level groups and permissions settings. ===Windows=== Examples of commands that can list groups are net group /domain and net localgroup using the Net utility. ===Mac=== On Mac, this same thing can be accomplished with the dscacheutil -q group for the domain, or dscl . -list /Groups for local groups. ===Linux=== On Linux, local groups can be enumerated with the groups command and domain groups via the ldapsearch command.
objects.x_mitre_detection: Adversaries may attempt to find local system or domain-level groups and permissions settings. ===Windows=== Examples of commands that can list groups are net group /domain and net localgroup using the {{LinkById|S0039}} utility. ===Mac=== On Mac, this same thing can be accomplished with the dscacheutil -q group for the domain, or dscl . -list /Groups for local groups. ===Linux=== On Linux, local groups can be enumerated with the groups command and domain groups via the ldapsearch command.
